oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 721 Part 2 - 1943-05-09 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with [Unconfirmed] on organ. This is the second part of the 721st airing, recorded on May 9, 1943.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The women of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" [incomplete] / (0:42) Richard L. Evans reads a passage about Mother's Day / (3:36) [Unconfirmed organist] performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" / (4:31) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (4:45) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "Elsa's Procession To The Cathedral" composed by Richard Wagner / (8:38) Richard L. Evans announces the closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
